docs.lead_paragraph: AOL had recently altered its 401(k) program, and its chief executive, Tim Armstrong, apologized for linking the move to soaring medical costs associated with two families’ “distressed babies.”

headline.main: Facing Criticism After Remarks, AOL Chief Reverses 401(k) Changes
headline.print_headline: Facing Criticism After Remarks, AOL Chief Reverses 401(k) Changes

docs.abstract: AOL chief executive Tim Armstrong reverses unpopular change in media company's employee benefits program and apologizes for singling out two families' health care issues as cause of changes; company had recently altered its 401(k) program, linking move to soaring medical costs associated with 'distressed babies' in employees' families.
docs.snippet: AOL had recently altered its 401(k) program, and its chief executive, Tim Armstrong, apologized for linking the move to soaring medical costs associated with two families’ “distressed babies.”

docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS), in an effort to keep insurers from denying coverage to people with HIV/AIDS, may strengthen its position on health plans accepting third-party payments, such as those under the 1990 Ryan White Act.

docs.lead_paragraph: Democrats sought to turn the latest controversy over Obamacare and the economy into a positive political message on Sunday by casting an expected decline in American work hours as a boon to worker freedom and family values.

docs.lead_paragraph: Health care spending and employment have been down, hurting the recovery.

headline.main: Will Saving on Health Care Hurt the Economy?
headline.print_headline: Will Saving on Health Care Hurt the Economy?

docs.abstract: News analysis; health care spending and employment have been down and are imposing a drag on the United States economy, in contrast to the way health care sector has repeatedly helped pull the economy from recession in recent decades; reasons for slowdown are not easy to see but the consequences are--lower health care spending is not helping the economy to heal.
docs.snippet: Health care spending and employment have been down, hurting the recovery.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Are the effects of Obamacare on employment a sign of things to come?
docs.abstract: Ross Douthat Op-Ed column examines what effect the work disincentives contained with the health care reform law will have in the future, particularly among working-class adults; contends liberals must decide whether a greater welfare state is meant to promote a link between work, security and mobility, or to substitute for the gradual decline of the workforce.
docs.snippet: Are the effects of Obamacare on employment a sign of things to come?

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: The spread of Chikungunya fever, a painful mosquito-borne virus, is a once-distant illness that public health experts fear will become entrenched throughout the region.
docs.abstract: Chikungunya fever, mosquito-borne virus common in Africa and Asia, continues to advance through eastern Caribbean but is unlikely to spread to United States; local governments are taking measures to keep disease under control and reassure tourists of their safety.
docs.snippet: The spread of Chikungunya fever, a painful mosquito-borne virus, is a once-distant illness that public health experts fear will become entrenched throughout the region.

docs.lead_paragraph: Ramogi Huma is the president of the newly formed College Athletes Players Association, a union that is seeking to represent football and basketball players.

headline.main: As Northwestern Players Pursue Unionization, a Voice in the Wilderness Gains a Chorus
headline.print_headline: Voice in the Wilderness Has Gained a Chorus Among College Athlete

docs.abstract: Ramogi Huma is the president of the newly formed College Athletes Players Assn, union that is seeking to represent football and basketball players; he turns in a petition seeking recognition for Northwestern football players to a regional office of the National Labor Relations Board Chicago, marking the first attempt by college athletes to organize.
docs.snippet: Ramogi Huma is the president of the newly formed College Athletes Players Association, a union that is seeking to represent football and basketball players.
